workflow.name: btap_create_necb_prototype_building
workflow.description: This measure creates an NECB prototype building from scratch and uses it as the base for an analysis.

workflow.name: btap_view_model
workflow.description: Visualize an OpenStudio model in a web based viewer

workflow.name: adjust_window_to_wall_ratios
workflow.description: This measure will adjust the window to wall ratio for all exterior surfaces. If one or more windows exist on an affected wall, they will be removed and replaced with a single ribbon window. Doors will not be removed. If the requested ratio can?t be achieved then the wall will remain un-touched.

workflow.name: btap_envelope_construction_measure_detailed
workflow.description: Changes exterior wall construction's thermal conductances, Visible Transmittance and SHGC where application for each surface type.

workflow.name: improve_motor_efficiency
workflow.display_name: Improve Motor Efficiency in Selected Fans and Pumps
workflow.measure_definition_display_name: Improve Motor Efficiency in Selected Fans and Pumps
workflow.description: The assessment team observed opportunities for motor efficiency improvements on HVAC systems. These motors are asynchronous induction motors.There are currently motors on the market that are far superior to standard efficiency motors. These come in both premium efficiency and ultra-efficiency which exceed NEMA Premium standards. These motors utilize a die cast copper rotor which reduces the energy requirements of the motor and allows the motor to run cooler. The motor also features an improved heat dissipation system and new low-friction bearings; both of which help extend the life of the motor. The motor also has a smaller weight and size compared to the standard efficiency motors. These high efficiency motors are showing efficiency improvements on the order of 3-10% more efficient than current standard efficiency motors.For all of the three-phase, asynchronous induction motors feeding AHU supply fans, specify premium or ultra-efficiency motors. The belts associated with the largest motors, longest run times, and that run closest to full load should be given priority when making replacements.

arguments.display_name: Choose a Plant or Air Loop to Alter.
arguments.name: object

arguments.display_name: Remove Baseline Costs From Effected Fans and Pumps?
arguments.name: remove_costs

arguments.display_name: Material and Installation Costs per Motor ($).
arguments.name: material_cost

arguments.display_name: Demolition Costs Occur During Initial Construction?
arguments.name: demo_cost_initial_const

workflow.name: reduce_electric_equipment_loads_by_percentage
workflow.display_name: Reduce Electric Equipment Loads by Percentage
workflow.measure_definition_display_name: Reduce Electric Equipment Loads by Percentage
workflow.description: Reduce electric equipment loads. This will affect equipment that have a, power, power per area (LPD), or power per person value. This can be applied to the entire building or a specific space type. A positive percentage represents an increase electric equipment power, while a negative percentage can be used for an increase in electric equipment power.

arguments.display_name: Apply the Measure to a Specific Space Type or to the Entire Model.
arguments.name: space_type

arguments.display_name: Increase in Material and Installation Cost for Electric Equipment per Floor Area (%).
arguments.name: material_and_installation_cost

arguments.display_name: Increase in Demolition Costs for Electric Equipment per Floor Area (%).
arguments.name: demolition_cost

arguments.display_name: Demolition Costs Occur During Initial Construction?
arguments.name: demo_cost_initial_const

arguments.display_name: Increase O & M Costs for Electric Equipment per Floor Area (%).
arguments.name: om_cost

workflow.name: reduce_lighting_loads_by_percentage
workflow.description: The lighting system in this building uses more power per area than is required with the latest lighting technologies.  Replace the lighting system with a newer, more efficient lighting technology.  Newer technologies provide the same amount of light but use less energy in the process.

arguments.display_name: Apply the Measure to a Specific Space Type or to the Entire Model.
arguments.name: space_type

arguments.display_name: Increase in Material and Installation Cost for Lighting per Floor Area (%).
arguments.name: material_and_installation_cost

arguments.display_name: Increase in Demolition Costs for Lighting per Floor Area (%).
arguments.name: demolition_cost

arguments.display_name: Demolition Costs Occur During Initial Construction?
arguments.name: demo_cost_initial_const

arguments.display_name: Increase O & M Costs for Lighting per Floor Area (%).
arguments.name: om_cost

workflow.name: reduce_night_time_electric_equipment_loads
workflow.display_name: Reduce Night Time Electric Equipment Loads
workflow.measure_definition_display_name: Reduce Night Time Electric Equipment Loads
workflow.description: Many buildings have electric equipment that runs unnecessarily at night.  Turning this equipment off at night can provide energy savings without impacting the day-to-day operation of the building occupants.  Before implementing this change, make sure that equipment can be brought back online quickly enough in the morning to avoid issues with occupants overriding the controls due to productivity losses.

arguments.display_name: Pick an Electric Equipment Definition(schedules using this will be altered)
arguments.name: elec_load_def

arguments.display_name: Fractional Value for Night Time Load.
arguments.name: fraction_value

arguments.display_name: Apply Schedule Changes to Weekday and Default Profiles?
arguments.name: apply_weekday

arguments.display_name: Weekday/Default Time to Start Night Time Fraction(24hr, use decimal for sub hour).
arguments.name: start_weekday

arguments.display_name: Weekday/Default Time to End Night Time Fraction(24hr, use decimal for sub hour).
arguments.name: end_weekday

arguments.display_name: Saturday Time to Start Night Time Fraction(24hr, use decimal for sub hour).

arguments.display_name: Saturday Time to End Night Time Fraction(24hr, use decimal for sub hour).
arguments.name: end_saturday

arguments.display_name: Sunday Time to Start Night Time Fraction(24hr, use decimal for sub hour).
arguments.name: start_sunday

arguments.display_name: Sunday Time to End Night Time Fraction(24hr, use decimal for sub hour).
arguments.name: end_sunday

arguments.display_name: Material and Installation Costs per Electric Equipment Quantity ($).
arguments.name: material_cost

arguments.display_name: O & M Costs Costs per Electric Equipment Quantity ($).
arguments.name: om_cost

workflow.name: reduce_night_time_lighting_loads
workflow.description: Many buildings have lights that run unnecessarily at night.  Turning these lights off at night can provide energy savings without impacting the day-to-day operation of the building occupants.  Implementing this change may require coordination with after-hours cleaning and maintenance crews.

workflow.name: btap_utility_tariffs_model_setup
workflow.description: Add the selected utility rate, as well as set the time step and lifecycle costing parameters.

workflow.name: btap_results
workflow.description: This measure creates BTAP result values used for NRCan analyses.

workflow.name: openstudio_results
workflow.description: This measure creates high level tables and charts pulling both from model inputs and EnergyPlus results. It has building level information as well as detail on space types, thermal zones, HVAC systems, envelope characteristics, and economics. Click the heading above a chart to view a table of the chart data.
